roleset.name: criticize, blame, judging harshly and negatively

example.name: criticize-v: transtitive
example.text: Temple , however , harshly criticized Sea Containers ' plan yesterday , characterizing it as a `` highly conditional device designed to entrench management , confuse shareholders and prevent them from accepting our superior cash offer . ''

propbank.arg: characterizing it as a `` highly conditional device designed to entrench management , confuse shareholders and prevent them from accepting our superior cash offer

example.name: criticize-v: with grounds as gerund
example.text: The internal investigation also criticized MiniScribe 's auditors , Coopers & Lybrand , for allegedly ignoring numerous red flags .

propbank.arg: for allegedly ignoring numerous red flags

example.name: criticize-v: with grounds as full clause
example.text: A Poquet spokesman , for example , criticizes the Atari Portfolio because it requires three batteries while the Poquet needs only two .

propbank.arg: because it requires three batteries while the Poquet needs only two

example.name: criticizing-n
example.text: I support our president for his criticizing of the unnecessary police harassment of Mr. Gates !

propbank.arg: of the unnecessary police harassment of Mr. Gates

example.name: critical-j: all args
example.text: Mr. Black believed that the therapist was critical of him for his obesity and addiction to chocolates , for his homosexuality , and for his masturbation rituals .

propbank.arg: for his obesity and addiction to chocolates , for his homosexuality , and for his masturbation rituals

roleset.note: CRITICIZE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'criticize' based on financial subcorpus; nominal 'criticizing' based on BOLT-6. Memberof VNcls judgement-33 . (from criticize.01-v)
CRITICISM-N NOTES: Based on sentences in wsj. Comparison tocriticize.01. Vn class judgement-33. FN classJudgement_communication. Framed by Katie. (from criticism.01-n)
CRITICAL-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, criticize-v.01.Corresponds to VNcls judgement-33. (from critical.01-j)
CRITICIZING-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from criticizing.01-n)

roleset.name: of utmost importance, crucial to

role.descr: situation that arg1 is critical to

example.name: critical-j: args 1, 2, critical to
example.text: Although 79 percent of patients received antibiotics for at least two days , the timing of treatment was critical to their outcome , the researchers found .

propbank.arg: Although 79 percent of patients received antibiotics for at least two days

example.name: critical-j: critical in
example.text: Other lawmakers and officials argued Thursday the records analysis was critical in protecting national security .

example.name: critical-j: all args
example.text: The in - depth analysis was critical for the laboratory managers in understanding the laboratory operations and functions at a very detailed level .

propbank.arg: in understanding the laboratory operations and functions at a very detailed level

roleset.note: CRITICAL-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WordNet. (from critical.02-j)

roleset.name: in grave physical condition (medical)

example.name: critical-j: standard
example.text: The clinical condition at the beginning of treatment was ' critical ' or ' poor ' in 15 cases .

roleset.note: CRITICAL-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WordNet. (from critical.03-j)

roleset.name: judge carefully, but not necessarily negatively, esp art/literature

example.name: criticism-n
example.text: First , his political work remains more prominent than his literary criticism .

example.name: criticism-n: both args
example.text: In his literary criticism of radical writers , he is very sharp and not entirely inaccurate in describing both them and himself at a certain stage as a " snob "

example.name: alias-j
example.text: And for someone who has critical thinker in his / her avatar , it is obvious you do n't know what that means .
